meanings.definition: Of or relating to architecture or architects.
meanings.sent1: The architectonic drawings displayed the intricate details of the building.
meanings.sent2: The architectonic style of the house showcased the architect's talent.
meanings.sent3: The architectonic blueprint seemed to come alive with each stroke of the pen.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked in an architectonic manner, carefully planning each step.
meanings.sent5: The architectonic features of the cathedral left visitors in awe of its beauty.

meanings.definition: Having a systematic and structured design or organization.
meanings.sent1: The architectonic layout of the garden made it easy to navigate.
meanings.sent2: The architectonic approach to problem-solving ensured efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The architectonic arrangement of books on the shelf was both practical and pleasing.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts followed an architectonic pattern, logical and clear.
meanings.sent5: The architectonic structure of the schedule kept everything running smoothly.

meanings.definition: Serving as a unifying or organizing principle.
meanings.sent1: The architectonic concept behind the project brought all the ideas together.
meanings.sent2: The architectonic theme of the event tied all the elements harmoniously.
meanings.sent3: The architectonic idea of teamwork was evident in their seamless collaboration.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style had an architectonic quality, guiding the team towards success.
meanings.sent5: The architectonic vision of the company inspired unity among employees.
